thread.title: The world's worst cities for traffic
thread.title_full: The world's worst cities for traffic

title: The world's worst cities for traffic
text:
Previous slide Next slide 1 of 11 View All Skip Ad 
The UK is the second most gridlocked country in the world, according to new research that names the cities most likely to experience traffic congestion. 
The TomTom Traffic Index ranks 390 cities from 48 countries around the world. Among the top 100 worst congested were 11 UK cities, with only China having more. 
Belfast was named the most congested city in the UK (and 18th busiest in the world) followed by Edinburgh and London. 
The busiest day on the roads in London last year was revealed to be Thursday, June 23rd, when British motorists took to the polls to vote on the referendum. The research also suggested Londoners wasted 6.3 days stuck in traffic compared to the average driver around the world. 
Here we count down the 10 most congested cities in the world... Getty
